the screenplay was really poor and steady line, without up and down, the cliché base story of predicting things and rounds one by one, mix of horror and comedy and the balance turns to comedy aspects. story is for the range of teenagers, for flush enjoying of happenings and events, without logic or reasonable origins, in one word the story is disaster, about the playing the actors no comments and almost all of them were new comers and no superstar, or artist. music below normal, camera and shots normal for 2000s, special effects very poor even for 2000s movies. other thing that was a little interesting was to remembering viewers that die is near so be careful, any way for most of the aspects of a movie it was among 0 to 3 out of 10 score. and also the name of movie from my point of view was not coherent with what was inside it.

This film is so cool, it's one of my favorite movies and i have seen it at least 20 times. Plane crash is best bit at the beginning, and has a clever and original ending10/10Another thing is that Alex, the main character is the main character in the 'Stan' video by Slim Shady

Review title: 'I wish someone would be alive for FD6'
Review_body: The best of all, others are perfect too ,except from FD4(it needs to be re-shot with low budget as it was in Paranormal Activity series this will be really good).First film still jumps my skin when I watch it on TV or somewhere else,It still keeps it's reality and magic.These kind of films are very rare in the cinema world.There are many successful actors/actress in this film,but the most distinctive actress is Clear Rivers,(but I wish she wouldn't die in the second film)and actor is Dewon Sawa I don't know whether he died or not,but according to the newspaper article in the second film,'While Devon was passing by the construction building a brick fell from the roof and hit Alex's head.But this is just an article,there is no exact information about him in the film,so this thing remind me (Producers writing IN HIS MIND deaths doesn't make IT FACT),but many people allege that he died,nevertheless I don't believe it :)

Review title: This has to be one of the most terrible horror movies I've ever seen
Review_body: This movie is completely ridiculous. The premise, that people can cheat death but then be fated to die, is not bad. But the execution on the movie is so terrible that it becomes comical and lame. The buildup to before the plane crashes is long, drawn out, and overdone. And that's not even the worst thing about the movie. Each death scene shows a person doing regular activities, and they focus on about 17 different ways that person could die, until finally, after a ridiculous long amount of time, the person dies in the most completely impossible and stupid manner you could imagine. And not only that, the dialogue falls flat on the floor. There's nothing about the movie that even makes you remotely care about whether any of the characters live or die. I would expect better out of a high school project. I won't describe any of the death scenes in case you actually want to watch it, but my advice is: DON'T. I've seen a lot of horror movies, and this is probably in the bottom 3.

Review title: quite decent little teen horror flick
Review_body: I did not expect much of this movie. The idea, some people surviving a plane crash and then being haunted by death, seemed far-fetched, and I had heard some pretty negative comments from friends. But then not everyone is a fan of teen horror movies, and I guess the negative reactions were mostly due to that. Of course the plot is far-fetched, of course there are some inconsistencies, and of course this isn't anything meaningful. But I think that teen horror movies have to be judged by the standards of the genre. And seen from this perspective, it does pretty well. First of all the production values are good, the editing careful (watch the title sequence with all the little cues), the overall design nicely thought out. Casting is o.k., even though Kerr Smith may seem a little out of place to fans of "Dawson's Creek". There are enough graphic deaths to keep the more gore-oriented faction of fans reasonably satisfied, the love story (doesn't every teen horror flick need one) is nicely subdued, and most important - it is at no time apparent what is going to happen next. The end, which some people seem to have found confusing, actually makes a lot of sense and cleared up a nagging feeling of being cheated that I had during the last ten minutes or so, expecting a typical happy end. Instead it leaves the future of the two remaining survivors at stake - inviting the (probably rather cheap) sequel that movies of this genre need. All in all a wholly watchable effort.

Review title: Final Destination lacks subtlety but is too tame
Review_body: From the opening titles it's clear Final Destination is a film about death and the makers really lay it on thick as if the audience is incapable of following a storyline without constant reminders about the subject. There are images of death, deathly screams, even a copy of Death of a Salesman.In the beginning we join Alex (Devon Sawa) a superstitious 17-year-old who is preparing to go to France on a school field trip. "You've got your whole life ahead of you," says his dad, like a black cat crossing his path to smash a mirror over his head.When Alex and his classmates arrive at the airport, director James Wong continues to treat you like the big idiot you are. Alex is handed a 'Death is not the end' flyer and the camera zooms in on the word terminal. Numbers are significant throughout the film, as if to say, 'your number's up'.Before the flight takes off, Alex has a premonition that it's going to blow up. He and some of the other students are subsequently removed from the plane and are sitting in the lounge in time to see it explode in a fireball. But there's no escaping death and one-by-one the grim reaper picks off the survivors.You spend most of the film trying to guess how they are going to die and Wong often leads you down the wrong path ­– like when Tod (Chad Donella) starts to shave and nicks his neck and then plucks his nose hairs with a pair of sharp scissors – neither of these things get him but you're made to think they will and you start to see danger everywhere. It's after the death of his friend that Alex starts to piece together the clues: "Death has a new design for all of you."When Final Destination was released in 2000, it was an original concept. It went on to win awards, including the Best Performance by a Younger Actor, and spawned a series of films. But it hasn't aged well and when you watch other horror films it seems rather tame in comparison.

Review title: The best movie of all time!
Review_body: Not only are the death scenes in this movie are thrilling, but this movie is what I call 'genuine original horror'. Often when we watch other horror movies that include monstrous creatures, psychotic killers, and weird ghosts or spirits like 'The Ring', this particular villain in Final Destination is the Grim Reaper. The Grim Reaper is a devilish spirit in who some of us believe and some of us don't. In this movie, I believe the tension will crawl up in your nerves, and possibly in the end thinking up of the question - Does the Grim Reaper really exist? or Is it true that some people who die of freak accidents are really stalked by Death or just coincidences? Death is what I would call the most inevitable villain, watching you at all times. Death does not appear in front of your eyes and is an invisible presence. Plus, it's definitely not one of those clichéd horror films! My #1 favorite movie! My rating: 10/10

Great fun teen horror thriller with an unknown cast and a very original twist on the slasher movie genre. A party of US smalltown high school kids are setting off for a trip to France when Alex (Devon Sawa) has a sudden, fearful premonition that their aircraft is about to explode on take-off (be warned, nervous fliers, this is probably the most chilling crash sequence since Alive). He flees the plane and in the panic five of his schoolmates and a teacher go with him. And sure enough, minutes later, the airline is blown to smithereens. So far so exciting, but if this is a slasher movie, where is the killer? Well, we're getting to that. As they try to rebuild their stricken hometown after the horror of the accident, the surviving kids start dying off and Alex soon realises that, having cheated Death once, destiny is trying to catch up on its homework. In a a sense, Death itself is the killer.And for another twist, Alex works out that the victims are dying in the same order that they would have been killed had they remained in their seats on the airliner. And so, by the logic of rather silly paranormal movie lore, he leaps to the conclusion that by breaking the pattern of mystery killings, he can escape his otherwise certain doom. All this nonesense is delivered with frenetic pace and no small amount of directorial wit from former X-Files back-room-boy James Wong. Although it's not original in its use of pressure-cooker suspense (the train speeding towards the car stuck on the level crossing, the loose mains power cable whipping in the wind as teen X struggles to escape electrocution just millimetres away) but to his credit, Wong never ends these scenes quite the way you expect. Final Destination is delicious date movie entertainment; compares favourably with such comical teen thrillers as Scream and The Faculty and boasts a glorious surprise ending which will leave you with a wickedly satisfied smile on your face.

There are some very unfortunate parallels with this film and the TWA 800 disaster 3 years ago. Not only is the flight number quite similar, that plan was also destined for Paris. The other obvious coincidence is that the TWA flight also carried a group of students and teachers who as far as I am aware all died on board. I'm not sure where they got the television footage, but I hope it was not from that flight.Apart from that, the film was obvious and unfortunately not very scary at all. The characters were not expended upon, and the things they said and did, didn't always make a lot on sense. (At least in keeping with the character.)There were a lot of loose ends, like the bloke in the undertakers. (Was he death?) And the impossible was constantly happening.Poor, avoid.

Review title: Excellent premise for a movie, reasonably performed.
Review_body: *** SPOILERS ***This was a bloody enjoyable movie. I missed the first 10 minutes or so but it was easy enough to catch up. You couldn't call it horror. I wasn't scared. I watched it in my house on my own in the middle of the night with a storm a-brewing, and anyone that knows me, knows that even watching the Simpson's Treehouse of Horrors episodes on my own at night can put me close to brown trouser time.My point? It was a fun movie.Of the five death scenes (excluding the flight of course), three were so daftly convoluted that you had to laugh. In fact, after the first one I found myself really looking forward to the subsequent deaths just to see what daft ideas they'd come up with next. The second death was more of a shock. It was unexpected, in a way, as I was expecting another 'Mousetrap' scenario but was left with my mouth open at the instant dismissal of an easily forgettable character.The end pleased me. These films need twists, they can never be straight.Acting in these type of films is rarely great. The lead, Devon Sawa, was half-decent, the rest made the minimum of effort. Seann William Scott as Billy Hitchcock was the worst, he didn't seem sure whether he was one of his no-brainer characters from `American Pie', or `Dude, Where's My Car', or was he acting straight. A strange amalgamation of the two happened instead - forget the recurrence of 25/9 and 180 etc., the recurrence of him falling off his bike was the only decent moments for him.Overall it could've been so good; it's a great idea for a movie and was reasonably well executed. I'm not looking forward to the sequel.

Did you ever walk out of a movie feeling cheated?  I did last night.Agreed, some films do this intentionally (Patriot Games, Basic Instinct, Evil Dead) but some suffer from the problem of having a great beginning, a fairly solid middle and a seriously disappointing ending.Such is the case with Final Destination.  A French student's clairvoyant dream saves 6 other would-be pieces of fried chicken from a plane explosion that they witness from the terminal.  Thirty-nine days after the thirty-nine schoolchums die (including the professor that not too many seem broken up about), Death wants a little payback...in spades.  Our hero and his doomed friends try to figure out Death's "design" (killing each off in the order they would have died) and try to save each other from their fates while avoiding the FBI who want answers.Okay, decent semi-Hitchcockian (note one of the characters named Hitchcock) opening and a decent plotline, What went wrong, right?A few things, actually.  Firstly, there was no real love relationship at all.  This was an extremely subtle part hinted at but more or less was tacked on at the end.Secondly, there is the ending itself.  How terrible was this?  It felt as if the testing audiences didn't like the original ending so some new situation was written and alternate footage shot at the last minute. Even so, did they think this ridiculousness gave closure? Not to spoil the ending but ask yourself this question, would you fly on a plane six months after you've had the forementioned ordeal?Do yourself a favor.  Leave this film 20 minutes before it ends and imagine your own version of an ending.  I'll bet you my $8 movie ticket that your idea far excelled the way it actually concludes.  Sad, isn't it?

Review title: Teen Movie Only! - Story that lacks depth
Review_body: I originally sought out the movie because of the James Wong/X-Files link. I was hoping for some thought provoking movie  in the Horror Genre. But I was disappointed. The story lacks depth. Its essentially a bunch of teens running around getting bumped off. Does that sound familiar? On the plus side - the start was great. After the first 15 minutes, I was left wondering where could it go after this? Unfortunately it went to exactly the same place as the movie "scream"! I thought it was a great movie to look at and the acting was good, it was just the story that was lacking. I would recommend the movie if your are into teen movies or if you are a "teen". I guess if your are into the X-Files - you might want to check out what Mr. Wong is upto - its worth watching - But not buying! 06/10

Review title: You want adrenalizing entertainment? ...then go and see it!
Review_body: This movie excited me from the first minute to the last. A good plot.  A good movie which provides adrenalizing entertainment. But to be honest it must be said, that the first 20 minutes (the plane crash and it's following events)and 10 min somewhere in the middle (as it turns out that there was a "plan") only were the best. The rest of this movie neither had a good script nor can it claim any continuity those kind of movies usually own. But aside from that it was really scary and exciting. Go, see it and don't mind the little mistakes, they are really not worth  mentioning. 10.

I don't know what all you people are talking about dissing such a quality film as Final Destination.  Now I would agree not to compare it to Screem, I loved the first Scream but I though Final Destination was much better than Scream 2 or 3.  The film did not 'scare' me as such but it was definitely disturbing and shocking by the very fact the the "monster" in this horror movie was the very real fact of death and fate.  It may not have been an "arty" film nor completely flawless in it's story but what I did get was my £3.50 worth of movie and it's a film I will happily watch again.  Cast wise I didn't like the film.  I thought Kerr Smith would have been better in the part of Alex, Devon Sawa was very poor in that role.  Also the bit about the coroner didn't make much sense...oh yeah and the ending was a bit rushedI loved this film and despite the odd flaw in the film it is still one hell of a film...I hope Kerr Smith gets the recognition he deserves after this film and he and Ali Larter go on to join the current teen superstars such as Sarah Michelle Geller, Reece Whitherspoon, Katie Holmes and Joshua Jackson.Don't listen to the people in this place, go watch the film and decide for yourself!

This was not a good film. That I am sure of. The alarm bells started to ring about 5 minutes into the film, with the ridiculous style of direction - trying to be all modern and cool and keep the pace going, but still missing something - making a massive point of emphasising all of the little 'signs' of what was to come - these are the sort of things any director who assumed even a little intelligence in their audience would make a lot more subtle.After the intro, there were very few redeeming features. As I watched I continued to get bogged down in the really awful, long and drawn out deaths, which had me almost cringing in embarrassment, the laughable dialog and acting in places (Tony Todd's 'creepy' undertaker was unbelievably poor), and the sheer predictability of the film as a whole.In summary? Don't bother - this is one of those awkward films - it's not good enough to be a fun film, and it's not bad enough to be a fun film. If you want to see a good horror film, get the Shining. (2/10)

I wanted to give this movie a 10, but thought there might be something missing.  What that was, I don't know because as thrill movies go, this one would be hard pressed to beat.  The first 15 minutes set the rest of the movie up, with no let downs for the rest of the way.  I can't believe the movie was as long as it said because the thrill keeps you entranced.   The whole 'Knowing that you are fated to die next' theme is an awful feeling to think about later, causing some sleepless hours I think. *L*

Review title: Clever film that runs like a Rube Goldberg device
Review_body: I went into this film thinking that I was about to see a film on par with the Scream series.  Boy was I wrong!  Final Destination is an excellent film that brings about audience interaction when the elaborate death scenes are playing out on screen.  The basic plot is seven people survive a horrific plane crash after Alex (Devon Sawa) has a vision of the plane blowing up. The survivors are soon to learn that by surviving the explosion they upset Death's plan, and now the Grim Reaper is after revenge.  Unlike most teen horror flicks, Final Destination is actually quite low on gore, and actually has intelligent deaths.  What's more, its nature that is killing them, so the movie isn't spoilt by some wacky character in a halloween mask.  If you like suspense (this movie loves to draw out the scary scenes) and horror combined, this movie is a must see.Oh, and for those who don't know a Rube Goldberg device is a machine made up of normally unrelated objects, that when combined in a certain pattern and "set off" culminate in a single action.  You'll understand what I mean when you see Final Destination!

All in all a very good movie.  It is about a dude that has premonitions of death.  I think the acting was pretty good, the death scenes were some of the best ever being very original, the excitement kept my attention the whole way through the movie.  If you are into thrills and chills this movie is your best hope.  I'd give it atleast a 9 out of 10.

This is one of the best movies I've ever seen!! It was so scary and entertaining, and the acting was really good.  The guys were really cute too!  I even jumped out of my seat at one point and I've never done that before in my life!! Go see this movie!!!!

Review title: Most suspenseful movie in God knows how long (spoilers!!!)
Review_body: I have never walked out of a movie as traumatized as when i walked out of the theatre after this (i was scared going to the toilet for christsakes!!) Lets just say i will not be flying for a long time!  I have also never been compelled to throw up in a death scene before Todd's bizarro self strangulation shaving accident.  I have rarely jumped as hard as i did when Terry took her impromptu bus trip.  The visceral nature of the death scenes and the terror lying within the most mundane household objects (clotheslines, toilets, computers, coffee mugs etc)caused this movie to leave me with a distinct sense of dread and fear that i haven't felt for a long time (and hope i dont get for a long time again.)  What seperates this from the Screams and I know what.... of late (dont get me wrong - i love them) is that the killer in this isnt some movie freak with a butcher knife (or garage door opener) but the light switch i use to turn the light on, or the pillow i sleep on, or the computer i am typing this review on right now! This is up there for scary sequences alongside Drew in scream, or the opening and closing scenes of When a Stranger Calls (another highly underrated horror gem) Go see this is you want to remember what it is like to be scared.

This movie worried me like nothin since Candyman, which also featured the gloriously creepy Tony Todd. After seeing this, I took the back roads and avoided the highway all the way home from the theater so there would be fewer semi trucks to skid and fulfil death's plan for me. While some of the effects were laughable (the head, etc), I thought that the film took an interesting premise and developed it almost enough. It fell a little short sometimes with the logistics of how Alex was enlightened on the plane, but the scene with the mortician/Death character (the aforementioned Tony Todd) was, I felt, quite necessary and well done. Acting was fairly shaky, especially on the female end, but the beauty of this kind of movie is that it can be absolutely enjoyable without being technically great, or even that good. Despite the flaws in its formal aspects, I give it an 8.5/10.

Review title: Final destination breathes new life into slasher movies...
Review_body: When  I went to see this movie I thought it was going to be a boring run of your mill slasher flick but by the end of the movie I was quite surprised. There was good acting, good plot twists and more.   I was really surprised go catch this flick its worth seeing.

We went as a group of three bored guys wanting to watch a cool movie.  We left as three paranoid guys making sure we drove the speed limit and trying to determine which one of us was 'next'.  A black cat crossing the street in front of us on the way home either didn't help.Final Destination might seem to others to be 'Scream' without the slasher killer, but as I have not seen any other teen horror movies I am not aware of that.  What I got out of this movie was it had a unique idea for a plot, yet an idea which I, and perhaps many others, have had in their lives.  The idea that the grim reaper is out to get you.  That you won't get a chance to tell your grandkids how you had to drive a whole ten feet to school in a broken down car with no air conditioning and they better thank their lucky stars that they didn't live in the late 1900's.The acting was believable, although some of the characters' motivations seemed...odd.  Like, I believe it was Carter, always wanting to beat Alex and acting irrationally seemed too unrealistic to me.  But I didn't care, cause the movie was interesting and the whole premise made sense in a supernatural way to me.

This movie was very very good. It contained many twists and turns and I was either at the edge of my seat watching or leaning back and squinting at some of the very detailed deaths. Even though it had the gore, it was still a very good movie. Their were many great performances by some teen actors and over all it was a great movie.

Review title: Wow! This movie made me feel all weird inside!
Review_body: I went to see "Final Destination" expecting to see a good movie.  But after the first 15 minutes I realized that I was watching a FANTASTIC movie!  I knew that the rest of it would be great and it would have a great ending, and I was right!This movie is about a group of teens who escape death after leaving a doomed airplane before it took off.  Alex, the lead character, feels that this is not the end of their problems, because death will definitely try to come back and finish the job.  I sat in suspense throughout the entire movie because I knew something was going to happen sooner of later.  And when it did, whooo boy!  I thought this movie was well written, and all of the actors did a great job with their parts.Exciting, suspenseful, surprising and eerie.  All elements of a great thriller/suspense movie!  See it, you won't be disappointed. 10/10!

The trailers on this film were compelling but I did not have high expectations.  Glad to say, I was pleasantly surprised.  To many movies try to pass themselves off as scary and never scare me.  This was a real thriller.  The special effects were simple but I liked that.  The story was interesting and the characters were the kind of people you could really care about.  Not like those miscellaneous teenagers from the 80's horror flicks.This movie was a roller coaster ride !!!  And there were plenty of scenes where the audience cried out in total shock.Don't miss this movie, it's best on the big screen.

I saw this movie just before it comes to the german cinemas ;) and i must say, that it was really fun to watch it! The movie differs to others like Scream by the intelligent story. I didn´t know anything about the film and i guess, that it´s more fun that way! In good tradition to other "who will survive and what will be left of them"-movies ... Enjoy MTSNOOP 8/10

Review title: A must see for all fans of modern horror/thriller!
Review_body: This film is one of the best, most original modern horror films I've seen in a long time. Those of you who say the plot's non existent, lighten up! The originality and brilliant acting of the film make up for any plotholes. I agree with almost everyone else that this movie is not in the same league as Scream, however there are definitely more shocks throughout- whereas in most horror movies there's just one killer chasing a victim, in this film you're continually preparing yourself for the next shock, because you've no idea where and when it will come- or, in some cases, the shocks are completely unexpected (the bus scene???). The film contains everything to make for excellent, terrifying Friday night viewing- suspense (some of the death scenes are incredibly drawn out!), shocks, blood and a little humour! Go see it in a packed cinema to get the full effect- the whole audience will be gasping and screaming. This is one of those films that you just have to see again because there was so much you missed due to hiding behind the seat in front. Also, after leaving the cinema, I guarantee you will look twice before crossing the road.Overall, great direction, great story, great acting, great movie- the last thing I saw Devon Sawa in was Casper, and he's gone a long way since then! Kerr Smith is brilliant, portraying a completely different role to that of Jack in Dawson's Creek- hopefully we'll see much more of him in the future. The ending seems a bit like it was made up on the spot, but apart from that this film is a definite must see. 10 out of 10.

Interesting concept for a teen slasher flick (finally, everyone knows what's after them but they STILL can't do anything about it), and the acting was great, but there's only so much that can be done with a horrible script. The plot holes are big enough to drive that bus through (now THAT was a nice shock).  The dialogue, especially the responses of the characters, is just so unrealistic that the movie becomes laughable.  The death scenes are done very nicely at first, especially the real crash, and then they spiral down into absurdity.  Give the cast credit for doing what they could with the script, but please screen-test more than just the ending next time.

Review title: "this film kept me, on the edge of my seat"
Review_body: I thought is was one of the best films, i had seen since the first Scream. this film kept me on, the edge of my seat, i have been three times to see it and it still make me jump. i would give it 10/10 for Greatness. if there is a film to see, this is it, Go and watch it, but don't forget a spare pair of underwear!

Review title: NOT a movie for the paranoid!
Review_body: This movie was a great suspense thriller. A few good lines, most actors did a good job, but some did not feel "real". The ending scene was WAY too long and made the film look a bit "stupid" and funny. That was obviously not intended by the movie makers.All in all, one of the greatest teen-chills I have ever seen...

This is one of the best thriller horror movies of the past decade. Unlike scream and the rest, there is no slasher or real bad guy; No monster, just the presence of death. It is NOT as good as "The Sixth Sense", but its not the same type of film. This movie keeps you on the edge of our seat (which is what a thriller is suppose to do), it hints to things like any good thriller and lets you try to pick up on the hints that it gives you.If your looking for a cheap horror movie with females getting naked or some cheap slasher movie that you don't have to think about, then this film is not for you. But if you want a really good thriller with a great story, rent this one.

Review title: A film adaptation of the board game, Mouse Trap.
Review_body: Apparently the screen writers in charge of this script were highly influenced by the popular children's board game, Mouse Trap.  You know, where someone turns the crank which makes the stop sign hit the boot which kicks the bucket causing the ball to roll down the stairs, hitting the hand that drops the ball into the tub which falls on the see-saw making the man flip into the pool which drops the net on the mice.  Only in this film someone makes the stop sign swing a little to hard causing really bizarre thing like explosions, impaling, and black 'water' to come out of your toilet all resulting in someone's death.  The plot was...well...pretty typical.  The only really unique thing about this thriller is the fact that every sort of happens via ridiculous chain-reactions.  If you're looking for a good teeny-bopper thriller/horror flick ( like one of those even exists)...avoid looking here.  If you've ever played Mouse Trap, you've already seen this movie and honestly, the game is more realistic and entertaining.

Review title: The best teen horror flick there will probably ever be
Review_body: Final Destination was a very unique film, in that it was a teen horror flick, and it was good!  There is actual suspense and creepiness throughout the film, whereas in Scream and I Know What You Did Last Summer, they were trying too hard to add it in.  Plus what's scarier than a villain you can't see?  Everyone I know who has seen this film loved it, including me, and I despise most horror flicks.  It's not so much that this movie is an incredible movie on its own, but I think its popularity comes from it being a great horror film in a land of cheesy horror.  The only really bad part I wish they would have taken out was the part with the mortician...it's the only cheesy part throughout the entire film.  A+++++

Review title: The death has his own plans, To kill that movie, Nailed it.
Review_body: I've always wanted to see that series of "Final Destination" Dunno why.At the start it seems to be a great movie, A teenage boy who had a vision of a plane blowing up, After he had that vision he was in shock and want out, SO he got out with a few of his classmates, apparently the plane did explode, Loved the idea, Im sure it could be a way more better movie.The movie seems to bee unrealistic AT ALL, Every death was so predictable.Lets talk about the teacher's death, She was so calm, listen to her mother's music, making her self some hot drink, suddenly the cup got a little crack(How strange), The water was dropping and the teacher?, didn't notice, she walking around with a cup that drops some water, She walked over the computer and was ahead of it, the cup dropped some liquid, BOOM the computer got explode, How realistic.The end was even worst in my opinion.

Starring: Devon Sawa, Ali Larter, Kerr Smith, Chad E. Donella, Amanda Detmer, and Kristen Cloke. Directed by James Wong. Rated R (for terror violence and language).This film has so much potential. The idea was great; sort of futuristic in a way. The film brought me thrills and chills and it doesn't fail to disappoint if you're in for a fright. I was shocked by the gruesome deaths and was pleased with the surprise ending. I would definitely recommend this film but it isn't for the faint hearted or squeamish. Although I happily gave the film a 7 for it's plot I would have preferred maybe a more stylised approach to filming. I was impressed with Devon Sawa's acting, maybe one of his best films and teamed with Ali Larter they give a great performance.You'll finish watching this film maybe with a different outlook to life, it certainly changed my attitude to fate and next time you're on a plane you'll think twice about those nightmares you've been having.

I really loved this movie! It was well thought, well made, and it had both funny and scary moments. This was really good, and with the greatest ending i've ever seen on a horror movie!!! This movie shows the story of a young man, who goes on a trip to France with the rest of his high school class (or at least tries to). Before getting inside the plane he starts noticing some sort of "coincideces" or "ironies" around him. He doesn't pay attention to them at first, but after getting inside the plane he falls asleep and has a very weird and scary dream about it exploding. He suddenly awakens and tells everyone to get off the airplane. Nobody believes him, yet some of his friends get off with him, including one teacher. A few moments after airing, the plane explodes.But the story doesn't end there. The seven survivors of the 180 flight start dying in a series of mysterious suicides and accidents. He alter realizes that when he got off the plane, we messed up death's plan, and now death was after him and the rest of the survivors, seeking to end up it's job, in the exact same order in which they would have died in the plane.Now, the only way to be saved from it was to cheat death again, messing ultimately with death's plan and have a long normal life.It's a really good plot and the end will really surprise you :)!!!!

Review title: One of the best films ever made, honestly
Review_body: I well remember watching this movie in the cinema. Me and my mother were bored so we went there early, about 6pm. After we saw this movie we had no idea what to do with the rest of our night. Because everything was just stupid and boring and lame compared to this masterpiece! The story is so great, why didn't anyone think of it before? Death trying to cross of all the names on his list, no matter what happens. That's genius! Once you get the idea behind it you start guessing how the persons gonna die, so it's also great fun. No, really, watch this movie if you haven't already done so. If you are into horror movies and also like intellectual entertainment, then Final Destination is the one for you. If you like splatter, then watch FD 2. Same story, more blood. Anyway, 10 points well deserved.

These movies are are entertaining and different at the same time something that you don't see in every movie, like over 10.000 horror movies even more have the exact same story line a masked killer,disfigured killer or something else point being it's easy to predict you feel like you've seen it before, give it about 4-5 in rating very below average blow the movie budget in making more movies like the Final destination 1,2 and 3 not really horror movies sure not suitable for kids :-),the entire movie you're not gonna be 100% sure what's gonna happen next and they always find the way to have a very happy ending well not for most people but for me i just watch these movies to see people die, helps having a good story line and some scenes with naked girls of course who doesn't like those :-),and yes it's not the ending you'd expect it's not the fairy tale ending like you see in most movies definitely not the ending you'd expect but it's the ending we all like and can share and enjoy and keep adding into slasher movies that is what they're all about and should certainly keep on showing over and over again i give this movie 7.3 in rating, FD 2 7.1 and the third one about 6.8 they're good for a good amount of viewings so that's what i had to say :-) (sorry for grammar errors)

Final Destination was the best scary movie I'd seen at the time.  It was very original, it didn't have any actual flesh in blood person doing the killings.  Death was a presence that killed using everyday occurences (slipping in the bathtub, fire, car accidents, tripping and falling on the wrong thing, ect.) those were the things that you thought about when you left the theater, that these things can really happen at any time and place. I cannot wait to see if Final Destination 2 is as good as this one. Final Destination is a must see for horror/thriller fans.

Although not fantastically amazing special effects/cast/even storyline, there is just something about Final Destination which makes it a teen horror/thriller that you *have* to see. Maybe it is the fact that it doesn't have fantastic effects etc. The lead is a handsome young chappy who does a good job of his role, the rest of the cast play their parts well and though not the most famous of casts, they fit into their roles suitably well. The story is quite intricate with funky little twists and is good compared to others, I felt that this film had more story to it than most teen horrors which gave it it's charm. I give this film 8 out of 10 simply because I love it! The sequel however I feel failed it greatly and could have been done a lot better, thus I prefer to think of Final Destination on it's own without its sequel, because I know it doesn't do it justice.

Review title: Reviews apparently written by elementary school students.
Review_body: I gave it one star because it made me laugh a lot. The Rube Goldberg death scenes, and the total implausibility of so many scenes had me laughing out loud. Usually before a train hits a car on the tracks, it slams its brakes into emergency, even though it'll never stop in time. But this train just continues to race along after the giant Hollywood pyrotechnic explosion engulfing the engineer's cab. And when friends see their friend decapitated, the don't generally shrug it off and come up with plan B. Live wires on the ground,although potentially deadly, don't fly around through the air setting fire to everything in sight. The death scenes are what really made me laugh. They were so contrived it was like watching a thousand dominoes falling to achieve a ridiculous end. I thought it was terribly insensitive for such a poor story to be inspired by an actual tragedy (TWA Flight 800) where a local town to me lost 16 high school students and 5 chaperons, including the son of a friend and coworker of mine. To this day, it is a sore subject where I live.

Review title: An almost good comedy after all
Review_body: Watching this film as a comedy: ok, some good laughs, in fact, I wonder why they dont list it as a comedy. But watching this as a horror/thriller...well..huuuh...people over 9 years old thrilling at this may suffer from some sort of anxious psychological behavior or something.... Here's my rates: +5/10 as a comedy and -1/10 as a thriller.Conclusion: i really don't recommend this ...movie(?), even to have some great laughs.

I did not know there were sequels to this dire tragedy of a movie until I searched for it and they came up on auto complete.The fact that sequels to this exist and sold further reduces my faith in human kind and reinforces my own belief that I am not part of this race and am proud to say that.The premise of this movie was good! It had a philosophical point, you can't cheat death... but it was so badly executed I couldn't bare to watch it to the end.In short, the premise was good, the plot was good, the actors acted the parts they had been given with skill. The direction, the photography were all top notch... but whoever wrote this script should be subjected to some kind of non fatal but painful and permanently disfiguring acid-genital torture.Recently I watched "Cast Away" with Tom Hanks, now its not the best movie I've ever seen but it made some points without having to say them and in its own simple way moved me."Final destination" however seems to either, aim at an audience that cannot be moved and need everything explaining to them (perhaps the dead, stroke victims, or the population of Norfolk), or, more likely, was written by an heartless UN-imaginative meeting of corporate types.The premise and plot of this movie could have made a wonderful experience if not executed (and I mean that in both ways, conducted by and killed by) utter sh!t heads.

Review title: A adolescent terror film, but something different
Review_body: I have to say that I don't had knowledge of this film, and I thought that this was another one film of adolescent terror, but in fact, I was enough surprised at end of the film, mainly by the beginning, which hooks you to the film. Although at end the story loses interest and is quite predictable.A group of students are in an airplane (go to Paris), but then one of them has one vision that saves his life and the life of some of his companions, and those visions continued in all the story with more or less fortune.Definitively one film more of adolescent terror, but something different, that at least it does not try to do that you laugh, nor presents the deaths like something graceful.

Final Destination is an original piece with a storyline somewhat out of the Twilight Zone. Basically a handful of teenagers escape death (due to the premonitions of the lead character) by boarding off of a plane which explodes shortly after it takes off. Shortly afterward, they all begin to die one by one...in what at first appears to be random circumstances.My liking of this movie comes mostly due to the fact that movie offers a fairly original screenplay (in todays movies) and its (though light) existential approach. The acting is alright, nothing special, but then again nothing really bad (Ala some of the other slasher films of the late ninties).In short I think this is one of the more intelligent and original films of recent days and would recommend people to watch it at least once. Like I said the acting is nothing special, and the story does have a couple of flaws in it, but overall its fairly enjoyable.(If you haven't seen the movie yet...please READ NO FURTHER!!!) My biggest problem lies after the characters figure out about death's plan. To me it seems that there shouldn't have been anyway that they could have cheated the plan (in the second one it gets even worse)..but they do. I know some of you might point to the last scene...but the fact that they could make it even that long.....well suspension of disbelief I guess.

Review title: not a review, but comment on incorrect "fact"
Review_body: Alex picks up a rusted fishing hook and says "tetanus", which is wrong. Plain rust does NOT cause tetanus. Tetanus is caused by a bacteria commonly found in horse manure. So unless that hook was contaminated by horse manure containing the tetanus bacteria...NO tetanus! lol

This movie is unique. Really unique, and probably one of the scariest horror films of all time. Ignore the rotten tomatoes and metacritic. YOU NEED TO SEE THIS MOVIE. I was scared to go on planes after this movie. I'm confused on why this is so bad with critics. You should definitely watch this movie.

Back in the 90s and early 2000s, Most of the horror movies including my favourites as well just had a masked killer chase teenagers. But this was a unique concept, considering how "Death" can go after the survivors of the plane crash simply without an entity. The movie is about a French class going on board Flight 180 to Paris, but one of the students called Alex saw how the plane was going to crash. 6 people got off the plane with him, thus Death comes after them one by one. They weren't supposed to get off the plane, their fates were set in action to die on the plane. But Alex changed that. In my opinion, that is a brilliant concept. At least it was during the 2000s.The message they're trying to get here, is that you can't cheat Death. Death will always come back at you. So when you know there's going to be that one day that you will die, spend the time you have left now to live a full life. And people always say the Final Destination franchise has crappy deaths and cgi - Just go look the movies up online or something and watch for yourself. Especially this one, the first movie. I will admit that most of the deaths in the franchise aren't "realistic", but imagine if you're a director. You're really gonna let them all die by heart attacks and stab wounds? I'm still pretty sure if we didn't have this franchise we'd be stuck with 10 other masked killers by now. Overall, great acting, brilliant concept, brilliant movie.

This movie is soooo good! I loved it. It was interesting the whole way through. Normally when I'm watching horror movies on Netflix, I get kind of bored and go in my phone in the middle, but this movie was so good that I was watching the entire time. I would definitely recommend!

this movie is plain stupid. No computer screen do not explode, they implode, a knife falling from a 50cm height cannot acquire enough energy to pierce your chest, and I don't think the professor of French stored a tank of gasoline in her house which could explain the sudden explosion of the house....I could continue for a long time the list of nonsenses present in this movie....I wasted my time and my money. I want a refund and a compensation for one wasted saturday evening.

Great idea of teens trying to outguess Death. How long will it be before they are outsmarted? The special effects and the actors' performances take a back seat to the story line. The camera work is really neat!

All in all a good movie, although very disturbing especially in the fact that it is not concerned with something make-believe like werewolves or vampires but with death and fate which is beyond our control. I found Alex's vision of the plane explosion particularly disturbing, especially as I am afraid of flying and this was just so vivid and frightening. You could tell that the whole cinema was visibly shocked after this. Also, the subsequent deaths occurred as accidents which could happen to any of us!!

Contains SpoilersThis movie is better than Scream! The acting was good, and It was very suspenseful. You did know that something was going to happen but it turned out to be something entirely different. Sort of. For example at one point in the movie one of the boys head gets cut off but not at the place you thought it was.I also love the subtle little hints that death is around like the wind and the one song some how playing at everyones demise. In this way you know that it was going to happen soon.f your like me and get a little jumpy at blood, you may want to see it twice. I know that sounds weird but when I saw it for the first time I got a little jumpy but when I knew what was going to happen then I could take it. When I saw it the first time I didn't really take in that the same song was playing at everyones death but when I saw it a second time it jumped out at me.I recommend this movie for everyone, it was the best money I have ever spent.

This movie will grab you. Although it seems to be a teen horror flick, it will shock and entertain allegedly more grown-up viewers. The acting is good, but it is the script and execution that set this movie apart from most others. It is beautifully filmed. It scared me. It made me rewind it and watch it again. Even the credits were beautiful.

Review title: Completely unexpected...I soiled my trousers 3 times over!!
Review_body: I came into FINAL DESTINATION not knowing what to expect and I have to say I left the theatre pleasantly surprised (actually, that's an understatement. The movie shocked me so unrelentingly that by the end I couldn't wait to get home and change my pants).  I am not usually one to enjoy teeny-bopper thrillers, and I have NEVER been one to clutch my bag of Bridge Mixture in horror in any sort of movie.  However, the throw-away, casual, tongue-in-cheek manner in which this movie depicted deaths was for incredibly shocking...and I can't believe I enjoyed it. That is not to say that FINAL DESTINATION was all pant-wetting fun.  The characters were thinly drawn and the second half of the movie reverts to a few too many teen-horror/thriller cliches.  My biggest quibble was with a character named Carter.  He ruined many scenes by being completely unbelievable in the way he behaved and talked.  Now, this complaint may seem silly in a movie so full of convoluted logic, but the massive leaps of faith that the plot required never bothered me. This movie was ceaselessly entertaining and creative.  If you're willing to suspend your belief for the duration, sneak in a package of Depends, and don't mind graphic, twisted death scenes, I encourage you to go see FINAL DESTINATION. You certainly won't be bored.

Review title: It'll make you jump....and leave you wondering.....
Review_body: Okay, so maybe since I'm 17 I relate to the teen movies better, but I haven't seen a movie this good in quite awhile.  I work at a video store too, so I see my fair share of movies.  I don't think I've ever jumped so many times during one movie.  Even though it was somewhat predictable, it still kept me on the edge of my seat, wondering what was going to happen next.  With all the little surprises waiting around every corner, you'll never become bored with this thriller which has been so cleverly injected with spots of humor.  If you're into the whole idea of supernatural occurrences as much as I am, I definitely recommend you go see it.  For those who have nerves as weak as mine...you'll leave the theater quivering with fear and wondering just what's in store for YOU!

Review title: The Final Destination should have been straight to video
Review_body: Final Destination has to be one of the worst films I've ever seen.  Very seldom do I hate a movie as much as I hated this one.  The acting was mediocre and the death scenes were not only overly gory, but completely predictable and unoriginal.  While the movie had an appealing and interesting plot, it was carried out poorly; The movie threw you immediately into the story line without so much as being introduced to the characters first, which may have helped improve the poor character development.If you really want to see it, wait for it to come out on video.

Final Destination is a very good movie which worths every cent. Well it actually has a lot of scenes that are out there like the one with the teacher and the knifes in her kitchen, but the whole movie is a very good directed one and the actors are nice. After all you are going to the movie to spend to hours having fun. Scary???? Yes in some scenes it gave me the creeps. Better than "SCREAM" and much much better than "I KNOW WHAT YOU DID LAST SUMMER". In the end this movie makes you think: Do we really can avoid death for ever? Should we even try to avoid it?. The grade I gave to this movie is 8.

This film is certainly the best teen horror/thriller that we've seen in a few years (since Scream & I Know What You Did...) It starts with a tense, spooky 15 min opening scene, then picks up speed and never stops. Final Destination ups the spook factor and distinguishes itself with its killer, Death. We never see any manifestation of death other than a shadow here, a sudden wind there, which is much more frightening than a psycho killer. The deaths are truly inspired and surprising. The writers take everyday situations and add an inspired macabre twist. The characters are a little stereotypical, but the young actors are better than most. Kerr Smith stands out, taking on a character completely different from Dawson's Creek's Jack, and though I never particularly cared for Devon Sawa before, he carries his lead role here wonderfully. This is the best night at the movies I've had in quite a while, and I was still spooked well after the movie was over.

Ok, to everybody that is reading this, mark my words, you should see this movie and when you do you will be blown away.  This movie affected me on so many levels. I left the theatre feeling different, feeling changed. It isn't like the usual teen horror slasher flick, this has a mind and a good mind it is. But don't take my advice, see it for yourself...> My rating: A+++

This movie had a very unique story.  It could have been one of the best thriller/horror flicks made in recent years, if it wasn't for the less than believable reactions by the actors during some of the intense scenes.  The majority of the work on this film was focused on the several "death" scenes, which are some of the scariest I have ever seen.  The details are amazing and the surprise factor is better than that of Scream.  The acting was not superb, but decent enough to carry the story, which was not directed as well as it could of been, either.  I think it was James Wong's first feature film, so he gets bonus points for that.  All in all, it was really entertaining; definitely worth seeing in the theaters.  A big screen with great sound helps the effects tremendously.  Take a girl and she'll be grabbing your arm before you open your Jujubees.  Great date movie. 8/10

Review title: Not the best advert for air travel.
Review_body: An enjoyable enough yarn, it made a pleasant change not to have an indestructible lunatic coming back for more, post shooting, burning etc...Some genuinely jumpy moments too. Quite surprised at the '15' rating over here, as the kids in front of me seemed to be hiding on a regular basis.Well constructed, with the opening particularly good. If you're not into flying, this will convince you to sail.All in all, this is a good diversion from the current crop of stalk and slash movies but how long before we see this idea repeated - please no sequel - final, final destination might just be pushing it a bit too far.

The first half of the movie was amazing, but the second half fell apart a bit. Loved the plane exploding, at least they didn't screw that up and had the glass break at the same time as we saw the plane blow up. There wasn't many holes in the plot, but there were a few questionable scenes. Interesting ending however.

Review title: This movie terrified me... but in a great way!
Review_body: This has to be the best thriller I've seen in years. The young actor Devon Sawa brought to life an eeriness that was present throughout the movie. He shows a talent well beyond his years. I would recommend this movie to anyone who wants to be thought provoked and scared out of their wits. You will walk away feeling exactly as Alex (Devon Sawa) did in the movie, very eerie... death is coming. An awesome movie, what else can I say!

I don't want to sit down here and type out the premise of the movie, because it's been done already.  What I would like to mention is that people seem to overlook this one: Morgan & Wong, yes, worked on The X-Files, but they also wrote and directed many episodes of Chris Carter's Millennium - a TV series that ran three seasons on Fox, which in my opinion was much better and scarier than The X-Files. In fact it was the best of Television ever, nothing comes close.If you liked Final Destination, definitely check out Millennium (running in syndication on the FX channel).  Episodes: "The Fourth Horseman" and "The Time is Now" are very much in the vein of FD.  Because of the gore and intensity they brought to the show, I thought for sure it was going to be thrown off the air immediately.  Luckily it lasted for a bit longer.
Morgan and Wong don't pull any punches.My only criticism is their inaccurate depiction of the Hare Krishna devotee in the airport.  They're actually good people, but are depicted as brain dead psychos.  And Morgan and Wong do this every opportunity they get when they have a story in the airport.  Ha.  Oh well . . .

This was a very good movie. I didn't think it was going to be a good movie because it was only showing on one screen. It kept me on the edge of my seat the whole time. When the movie was over people in the the theater were saying that it was better than the Sixth Sense and even Stir of Echos.

Review title: The best movie I've seen in years
Review_body: This is without a doubt the best horror movie I have seen in the 90's so far.  It is everything you could ever want. It has great acting. A great story. The atmosphere is creepy and real. Not to mention the death scenes are original and quite gross. They leave many disturbing images in you head. I don't want to give away anything. It's worth every dollar I spent on seeing it. I might just go see it again.  Final Destination is movie making at it's finest.

This movie was frightening for one simple reason, it isn't afraid to go the route of talking about death, fate and if the inevitable is really unavoidable or if deaths plan can be fathomed and subsequently outwitted. The opening scene is downright scary, come on who hasn't got on a plane and wondered if it would crash, and let me tell you I am not in a hurry to get on one now.  Thought the story is a little contrived and a bit predictable(though that is part of the story) the effect is still the same. The movie is not, despite what you may hear, a teen flick, if you're a horror fan from any generation trust me you'll like it as long as you go in wanting to see it and willing to actually think about the film and follow the story line.  Trust me on this one and give it a shot.

this is one of the worst movies i have seen. the first thing i was thinking about was the haunting. it is supposed to be scary, but it is not. nothing surprised me in this movie. I don't have it often that i want to go out a cinema, but this was really bad enough to walk away for me. I hoped for a thrilling end but that was not happening. The end is not saying what happens in the movie. They could not tell it because it was so absurd. Sorry for this comment but i really had to say this.Yorick17

There are so many things wrong with this film that it may be unfair to identify any individual features(but I will anyway). The cliche-ridden, boring and predictable elements of this film make it one to miss. From the very start the symbolism is over blown and the father's recapping of the basic plot a few minutes into the film is lazy and assumes the audience are stupid. Similar faults reappear throughout. The script and acting is truly appalling and the film competes with Scream 3 for the worst horror film in recent memory.If you like to watch pretty people run around with no real purpose then this is for you.

Review title: The best teen horror flick since Scream!
Review_body: I have just been to see this movie and I have to say, it was absolutely fantastic!  You may think that teen slasher flicks are getting boring and repetitive, but once you have seen this, you will be persuaded otherwise. The whole film oozes originality and quirkiness.  This movie will have you on the edge of your seat, and the effects will amaze you!  GO SEE IT!!

Review title: it was about a kid that tried to cheat death
Review_body: this wasn't a regular horror thriller it was very orginal becuase it didnt have your average serial killer stalker. it was faith and death that was the killer which made it impossible to know whats going to happen or how there going to die. so to all those that didnt like this movie because it didnt have same kind horror plot please dont judge until you see it and if u did c it get better glasses

Review title: What a great movie Final Destination was
Review_body: The movie Final Destination is based on Alex Brownings(Devon Sawa) premonition of a plane explosion which turns out to be true.  7 lives are saved through this, but Alex is only hassled by the FBI, not to mention some of the fellow survivors. One by one, the survivors are killed off in bizarre coincidences and Alex figures out that there is a design as to how every person will die and he sees that they are killed in the order they would have been killed on the plane.  Alex sets about changing this and attempting to save his friends, but as it turns out, when death has finished going through the design, it starts over again . . .I thought that this was one of the best horror movies ever made.  I believe this because it has an original, unique storyline as well as some very gruesome and unsavoury moments.  This film is not for the faint hearted and should be renowned for its ability to shock and to scare.Also, this film has a great storyline with a relatively unknown, but great, cast.

This movie was great! You never knew what would happen next! It had an amazing cast (Chad E Donella!) There were always so many things that could happen to the people but the things that happened were totally unexpected. It was better than most horror movies because death wasn't caused by a person but by their fate. They couldn't control what happened to them and it made it so much better. My mom bought it for me on DVD and I've watched it over and over again! I recommend it to everyone who loves horror movies!

Review title: A new idea still comes across as a poor and formula film
Review_body: Badly written, Bad acting..what is Kerr Smith meant to be playing..Production values so low you expect to see the sets move..Flat boring lighting the film looks like a cheap made for TV film..DONT BOTHER WATCHING...And it commits the cardinal sin..A tacked on extra un-shocking ending..

If you enjoy having your intelligence insulted with an unremarkable script, a story premise which would be so totally off the mark, this is the movie for you.Do yourself a favor, forget renting this flick.  I was truly disappointed that IMDB doesn't allow me to vote what I feel this movie really deserves and that would be.  Less then Zero. Now that is a good movie.

Review title: How did this get to the theaters?
Review_body: Worst movie I've seen in a long time. Starts off with an interesting vision, but decreases dramatically in plot development and quality. I dunno what movie these other reviewers were watching. It's one of those movies that seems to have an interesting idea but is just made up as it goes along. Also, whats with the overly complicated deaths and John Denver music?

Review title: This is not a thriller. It's a comedy
Review_body: This is what I call a high-budget B movie. The times that I watch these kind of movies to the end can be counted on 1 hand! Every "exhillerating" moment in this movie is so predictable!! It's some time ago that I've seen this movie but this is one things I laught about really hard!!!! One of the "victoms" (a girl) slips on the kitchen-floor, she can't get up, she tries to reach for a cloth hanging over knife-block. You can guess what happens, hahahahahahah.This is a comedy !! not a thriller or a horror !!Wanna have a good laugh! Watch this movie!

Review title: oh my gosh what a wonderful thriller!
Review_body: Okay I've just got home from watching this with a few girlfriends, with my ears ringing! We just loved the suspense intended with this movie. Now I for one take a fair bit to get screaming, my spine tingling a little, and jumping out my seat. I laugh at other so called horrors, but this was different. Though I didn't scream, or get that tingling feeling, I found myself on the edge of my seat at times, clutching the arm rests. In all... it was awesome and there are a few deaths in there which are up there with my all time favorites

I thought that the Movie Final Destination was  completely cool and that I watch it every chance that I get! I love Devon Sawa, it was like he was born to play that part. Ali Larter was also totally cool. All the actors and actresses in that movie were excellent for the part that they played. My friends might be getting sick of me watching this movie over and over again but HEY I don't mind .

It's a great film...It isn't like another horror movies ..with ghosts, stupid crimes or stuff like that ..it's special and logic.. I enjoyed and I would see it again & again & again.. The actors acted very , very well...they have such a big talent... Interesting film..You can't know or guess the deaths..they are so creepy but at the same time it can happen every day to anyone...that's creepier..Final destination I was the best and original...the others..just a tentative..Also it has suspense.. and it's nice that teenagers play in this film...i think this is a plus..I would like to see film as good as this..but there aren't too many .. The film is also good because ALex seemed has passed in those actions for real..not just a movie ...and the replicas are very "deep" and make you reflect..and I won't say about Ali Larter..she's as good as Alexi ..They aren't very unknown.. I give a 10 with congratulations :)

Review title: A Balance that most movies lack
Review_body: This movie was practically perfect. It had the perfect balance of gore and plot development that most murder-horror movies lack. It wasn't a random killing of characters you don't know there was order to it and it made sense in a paranormal way. Most of the deaths were some-what believable too unlike it's sequel which was very far-fetched even though the teacher's death was overkill (A trail of vodka that exploded a computer which slit her throat causing her to slip on her own blood while making her way to the kitchen which caught fire from the trail of alcohol and the sparks from the computer and while on the floor grabbing a town which was on a rack of knives making the knives fall and stab her but not dying until a chair hit the knife in farther. Too much? I think so.). Some creatively sick minds apparently worked on the death scenes in this movie and it came together perfectly The whole plot was completely original (to my knowledge) and turned out to be a hit in my eyes.

Review title: None of the horror movies from the 70's up until now have thrilled me like "Final Destination!"
Review_body: It's about time that they make a terror/horror movie about something besides a killer killing everybody.  They've been making movies like that since the 70's and none of them ever thrilled me like "Final Destination!"  It's movies like this one that make life, death and fate so mysterious.
Good Movie Not so much blood and gore and it does scare me awesome movie

This film shows the sense of paranoia and fear about what will happen to you if you're gonna die like some unfortunate events will happen. You survived but only later to die another die. You never what's gonna happen. Great concept.
It's a nice movie.We can watch this movie near our family.
The film has all the right elements for success and many of them are executed pretty well. That doesn't mean it's perfect, there's still a lot of room for improvement.

Excellent film, makes you realise that it could happen at any time! The 'accidents' portrayed were reminiscent of those in 'The Omen' series of films but were sweetened with a slightly comic attitude to the 'cheating death' game. I would especially recommended this film to people who like contrived accident 'sketches' such as those in 'The Plank' and 'The Money Pit'.

This movie is great. How I got it was I was just renting horror movies and the cover if it looked good so I thought I would get it.The thing I liked most was the way they thought up to make the deaths look like a mistake happened or something.I must say this is one of my favorite movies I cant wait to see the second one.

This movie has the honour of being the only one I have ever walked out of half way through.While the idea had great promise, the way in which each character died went from the ridiculous to the downright unbelievably stupid.  It became embarrassing to watchActually got a refund from the cinema - we weren't the only ones to walk out!!

I gave this Movie a 9 because it was great. Devon Sawa is a very good actor i dont think there is ne 1 better. This movie was really good. I guess the most scary part was on the plane it actually gave me the chills I dont get them easy when i watch movies b/c i am a horror movie freak. But great job Devon and the rest of you guys!

Review title: Do we have to die because of other's mistakes?
Review_body: Hi, my name is Inesa and I'm from Ukraine. "Final destination" is one of the best movies I've ever seen.I liked it very much, but I'm a bit disappointed that there are only 3 parts of it.I've been thinking a lot about what might happen next if there existed the 4th part.I'm sure, those who watched the 3rd part would agree that this is not the end.What if in "Final destination 4" the main character finally meets Death, has a talk with her... for example -- she explains that if Alex did not walk out of the plane in first part there would be no other deaths, no car crash, no accident in the park and so on. That all these are the consequences of one's wrong deed. Just something like that.And than, finally -- the main character understands that he or she has to die in order to stop all those stupid deaths and bring peace to all the people...I understand that this might sound foolishly, but still, I'm interested in your opinions and would be grateful if the directors would still release the 4th part of this film.

Final Destination is an excellent thriller that focuses on a premonition, and several deaths. It's my favorite movie. Deaths have enough originals to what we have seen so far and very good actors, including Ali Larter, I can not complain. My favorite is the death of Ms. Lewton and also the last (for those who do not remember is the big poster) that horrible! Okay, I think a 6.7 is just as good for a movie (could say it is one of the best in recent years without fear of exaggeration), but after all it is a good result, thanks to the votes of many film buffs who think like me, because some films are lucky to get a 6.0. Highly recommended. Emanuel.

Now, it should be 1 for terrible, terribly funny! My goodness, I've been afraid of this movie for years. I watched for the first time, and I could not stop laughing. This isn't much of a review, sorry. A story of one crazy kid who gets SUDDEN insight that the plane he is on for a trip to Paris with his classmate will explode (which this event is totally not possible or probable). Only to wake up, sitting on the plane, and the events begin to play out, he goes total apeshit, causing a commotion leading to several students getting off the plane and being left behind. Then *shocker* the plane which can be seen in the back ground explodes! DUN DUN DUN. There's a funeral, boo hoo. Now a sequence of REALLLLYYY stupid deaths. Beware your toilets people ! If it starts dripping it will come after youuuuu. Tod didn't listen, so he slips , IMMEDIATELY when his foot barely touches it, causing him to do some graceful acrobatic movement into the bathtub and the shower head breaks and goes around his next like 50 times and he suffocates and dies. What a catastrophe. And other deaths include, a house going on fire, where a knife ends up piercing the woman in her chest and then a chair falls over and hits the knife in further lol. and then a piece of metal ricocheting from under a trying slicing a guy's face off. And some other mess. Anyway, this movie was mad funny! Wasn't much at all scary. Except for my mom, poor her lol she was terrified. This movie was good fun.

The acting... in and of itself was decent, but not great. The script... in and of itself was slightly decent, but far from great. The movie idea, the surprise/shock value and concept of the film were awesome...there were loads of times that i actually went... WHOA! The dream scene... where he dreams what happens on the plane... that was awesome!! totally brilliant.If you have ever seen or played a game called MouseTrap,... well, I really appreciated all the things that happened to people when they died. The ending was a bit silly and overdone, but that is OK.This was was a low budget, B movie... that made it better than it was... if it was given top billing and a bunch of $$$ was spent hyping it.. it would have sucked out big time.

I actually own Final Destinations one and two and Alex Browning LIVES at the end of the first one, but during the second movie at the beginning a police officer tells Kimberly that there was only one survivor out of the seven who got off the plane. Review title: FINAL DESTINATION -the first true horror movie
Review_body: Final Destination was a really good film with a few surprises and lots of blood and gore, which made it a nice and decent film. The story involves a high school french class that are going on a trip to Paris. Then one of the Students-Alex(the main character)has a violent premonition that the plane will explode right after take-off. The premonition is very realistic and gory. It was very heart-pounding because the director-James Wong- put lots of work and effort into filming this movie especially the airplane sequence. Then when Alex wakes up from his vision, he tells everyone to get off and causes an argument with Carter Horton- another character. Alex and Cater get kicked off the plane along with Clear-a classmate that felt Alex's vision, Billy & Tod-Alex's Friends, Terry-Carter's girlfriend, and Ms. Lewton-a teacher that decided to stay with the students. Then when the 7 people are sitting in the lounge,Alex's vision becomes reality when the plane explodes after the take-off. Then a month later Tod- Alex's friend ends up dead. Soon the seven friends start dying in mysterious ways-as if Death had been tampered with and was looking for payback. The deaths in the movie are spectacular and are very realistic considering that there is no serial killer or maniac running around trying to kill everybody. It is about a group of normal teens ending up dead because they cheated death. What is most surprising is that the people in the movie die because of normal household items or something that you see everyday e.g.-knives,buses,trains,clothes lines,computers,etc. And the thought that being stalked by Death is just plain scary because Death is all around us everyday. That is what makes this movie a real twist in horror movies and what makes it very successful.

I hated this movie, I really did. I thought Prom Night and One Missed Call was bad. I was expecting a bad teenage "horror" movie, but what I got was worse; an atrocious abomination of cinema that doesn't even have it's cheap thrills.It's not a good thing when before anything happens in the movie you've predicted who's dying in which order, who survives by the end, and then you turn out to be correct. The dialogue is horrible, and the acting is mediocre (with the exception of Tony Todd).The first kid who died (which is almost always the one with the worse hair) got killed by slipping on his bathroom floor and getting strangled to death in his bathtub by a wire I'm not even sure where it came from. How is bathroom strangulation scary at all! This is the most predictable piece of crap I've seen since just about every Sci-Fi channel movie ever! The ways these kids die are so unrealistic, one of them dies from a flying piece of metal that got run over by a train and cut off half of is head...no.Avoid this pile of rotten clichés at all costs. i wouldn't torture my worst enemy with this...

Probably one of the top 5 movies I 've ever seen ( the others are Armageddon , 8 Mile , 6th Sense & Rocky )and the best teen thriller I 've ever seen. The Idea is Great , the story is great and the execution is such as good. It had some gruesome deaths and it also shows the relationship of 6 teens who are totally different and they stick now together in order to defeat death itself... The end of the movie is unbelievably great and ( for those who have seen the sequel where the last survivors of flight 180 die ) I think that the meaning of this movie is that nobody can cheat the death. I think that this is the best teen thriller of all time and it is a must see movie for all the thriller fans.
